intro: Hieracium muricellum, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family (Asteraceae). It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant features yellow flowers with a distinctive ray floret and a central disk, surrounded by rough, bristly leaves. It grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has a hairy stem. Hieracium muricellum is often considered a weed but plays a role in supporting pollinators and soil stability.
